Line 172: Line 172:      
====Adveṣa, Maitrī====
 
====Adveṣa, Maitrī====
−
[[Adveṣa]] and [[metta|maitrī]] are benevolent love. This love is unconditional and requires a lot of self-acceptance. This is quite different from the ordinary love, which is usually about attachment and sex, which rarely occur without self-interest. Instead, in Buddhism it refers to detachment and unselfish interest in others' welfare.
+
[[Adveṣa]] and [[metta|maitrī]] are benevolent love. This love is unconditional and requires considerable self-acceptance. This is quite different from the ordinary love, which is usually about attachment and sex, which rarely occur without self-interest. Instead, in Buddhism it refers to detachment and unselfish interest in others' welfare.
     
===Hindu===
 
===Hindu===
